snippet: Declaring that New York’s government faces a crisis of public trust, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposals include requiring lawmakers to fully disclose their outside income and public financing of campaigns.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo calls on Legislature to pass clean-government program following Speaker Sheldon Silver's arrest on corruption charges; vows not to sign budget that lacks full slate of ethics reforms and urges lawmakers to fully disclose their outside income and public financing of campaigns in effort to rebuild trust with New Yorkers.

byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Declaring that New York’s government faces a crisis of public trust, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposals include requiring lawmakers to fully disclose their outside income and public financing of campaigns.

headline.main: Pushing Ethics Reforms, Cuomo Wants Lawmakers to Reveal Income or Lose It
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Wants Lawmakers to Reveal Income or Lose It
